item.title: Civic Engagement
item.description: Summary I have always been interested about IT and mostly about cybersecurity. So, when I had the opportunity to help organize the Toulouse Hacking Convention as a volunteer, I obviously proposed my help. The Toulouse Hacking Convention (THC), is an event that took place at ENAC engineer school between April 14th and April 15th. I proposed for 3 days, the first one was the day before the event to help with different installations tasks and then I helped during the 14th and 15th mornings.

item.title: Climate Fresk
item.description: The Climate Fresk was an opportunity to learn and to acknowledge about the Global Warming Situation. What is the Climate Fresk ? Climate fresk is a project that was created by the French Ministry of the Environment. It is a way to raise awareness about the climate change and the global warming. It is a way to make people understand that the climate change is a real problem and that we have to act now.

item.title: Sulitest
item.description: Please check here my final Sulitest results.

item.title: 1st Year Summer Job
item.description: Aknowlegments First of all, I would like to thank my boss, Mr. Dubois Marc, for giving me the opportunity to work in his company. I would also like to thank my colleagues for their help and their kindness. Also I would like to thank the clients for their understanding and their patience during my first days. Introduction Compagnie Presentation Marché Frais Orgeval is a company that sells fresh products. It is located in Orgeval, a small town in the Yvelines department.

item.title: International Mobility justification
item.description: During my second year internship I had the opportunity to work at SAFRAN Landing Systems with Airbus UK. I was part of the Landing Gear System team, and I was responsible for the development of a new tool to automate the analysis of the landing gear system. This tool was designed to help the team to identify potential issues and to improve the overall performance of the system. It was a work in an international environment, and I had the opportunity to work with a team of engineers from different countries (India and most notably UK).

item.title: Metz Presentation in Japanese
item.description: In japanese class we’ve been asked to film a 3 minutes video about a city. I chose to present Metz since, even if I lived in Paris, I was born there and most of my family still. If the video is not displayed correctly, you can find it here

item.title: 13 Matches game
item.description: Java project about a little game with matches. You can see here the subject i were given.

item.title: DVB-RCS signal transmission simulation
item.description: The goal of this project was to simulate a DVB-RCS signal transmission and find the name of one of our teacher at the end of the transmission channel. You can see here my report on this project.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways. :zap: Emoji Support The emojify function can be called directly in templates or Inline Shortcodes. To enable emoji globally, set enableEmoji to true in your site’s configuration and then you can type emoji shorthand codes directly in content files; e.g. The Emoji cheat sheet is a useful reference for emoji shorthand codes. N.B. The above steps enable Unicode Standard emoji characters and sequences in Hugo, however the rendering of these glyphs depends on the browser and the platform.

item.title: Huffman tree compression algorihtm
item.description: ADA95 project where we had to code a compression algorithm using the Huffman Tree. You can see here the my last report on this subject.

item.title: Mes Histoires
item.description: Personnal Project codded for a kindergarden. The application is coded using electron and web based programming languages. The Application was needed for a kindergarden because some teachers wanted to have their young student to be able to listen by themselves the nurseries rhyms and musics listened before in class. This app is simply a really simple music player with big buttons adapted to be used by children.

item.title: Minishell
item.description: Unix Shell coded in C You can appreciate here my final report on this project.

item.title: Spotiplay
item.description: The goal of the project was to make a music playing application. In our daily life, music is with us constantly (travel, relaxation, work, parties …). Nevertheless, we are used to listen to compressed music of lower quality than in the past. Indeed, the streaming platforms (predominant on this market today) are compelled to compress their audio files in order not to overload the servers and the internet connection. But some users want to listen to music in CD quality.

item.title: TIPE : Differents image compression algorithms study
item.description: Personnal Project during my CPGE. A video being a series of images, studying the method used by the jpeg format to compress them would allow us to understand the fundamentals of lossy image compression, but also to see how to adapt its operation to meet new challenges. You can appreciate here my final presentation on this project.
